Issues.Title: fix(forms): toggle disabled attribute when replacing control
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [X] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type
- [X] Bugfix

## What is the current behavior?
When having a [formControl] directive with a disabled control and replacing it with an enabled one, the disabled flag of the corresponding DOM element is not removed. Technically ngOnChanges will only ever set the disabled state of its DOM element to true if the control is disabled instead of also removing the disabled flag if the control is enabled.

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?
When setting an enabled control as input of [formControl] the disabled attribute of its DOM element will be removed.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [X] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(forms): toggle disabled attribute when replacing control" (#41609)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): do not error with prepocessing if component has no inline styles
Issues.Body: The asynchronous preprocessing check was not accounting for components that did not have any inline styles. In that case, the cache did not have an entry which then allowed the asynchronous check to run and fail the compilation. The caching during the asynchronous analysis phase now handles components without inline styles.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler-cli): do not error with prepocessing if component has no inline styles" (#41602)

Issues.Title: Define unique page titles in the Angular router (a11y)
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/packages/router and @angular/angular.


### Description
In order to increase accessibility and build in best practices, allow an option to provide a unique page title to each path in the Angular router. 


#### TitleService vs Proposed Change
Currently the TitleService allows us to manage page title, which allows developers to add unique page titles. This requires additional work for developers and the contextual knowledge to understand that this not only a best practice, but that page title _needs_ to be managed in order to make your application more accessible. 

Eventually I'd like to see this option enforced as mandatory or throw a warning if not defined, to ensure Angular apps are more accessible by default. This known property could also be more easily caught with a lint rule.

#### Context
W3 defines that [page title must be unique](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/page-titled). Angular is a single-page app and, as a result, a majority of transitions, such as moving to a new page, do not involve a page reload. This means that out of the box, each page is read with an identical page title, and provides no value for understanding the page's content or purpose for users using a11y services.


### Proposed feature
Define a know `title` property in the router's route definitions, which is then subscribed to automatically and uses the TitleService under the hood to manage page title on routing automatically.

```ts
const routes: Routes = [
  { path: 'chicken', component: ChickenComponent, title: 'Chicken - Farm Demo App' },
  { path: 'goat', component: GoatComponent, title: 'Goat - Farm Demo App' },
  { path: 'frog', component: FrogComponent, title: 'Frog - Farm Demo App' },
  { path: '',   redirectTo: '/goat', pathMatch: 'full' }, // redirects ok without a title
  { path: '**', component: HomeComponent }, // throws warning with no title prop defined
];
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
TitleService works, but again, it puts the burden on the developer to know about this single page app accessibility pitfall and how to implement unique page titles (and manage subscribing to the router ActivatedRoute or manage title in each route's component).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Define unique page titles in the Angular router (a11y)" (#41626)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): replace loadLContext with getLContext calls
Issues.Body:
This commit refactors the code to replace `loadLContext` with `getLContext` calls. The only difference between these two functions is that the `loadLContext` supports throwing an error in case `LContext` can not be found. The investigation performed in #41525 revealed that throwing while retrieving `LContext` might have undesirable performance implications, so we should avoid that to make sure there are no accidental perf regressions in other parts of code that used `loadLContext`. Moreover, in most of the places the `loadLContext` was already called in a mode that prevented an error from being thrown, so this refactoring should have no effect on the actual behavior.

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): migrate web workers to support Webpack 5
Issues.Body:
Webpack 5 now includes web worker support. However, the structure of the URL within the `Worker` constructor must be in a specific format.
A migration has been added for Angular v12 that will convert web workers from the old structure to the new structure.
Before: `new Worker('./app.worker', ...)`
After: `new Worker(new URL('./app.worker', import.meta.url), ...)`

Issues.Title: ESModule import is not tree-shaked
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package I'm not sure which exactly package is responsible for building the app. Probably, `@angular-devkit/build-angular`. ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description I have an external ESModule with named exports, now when I import only some of the named exports I expect webpack to tree-shake unused code in the final bundle. However, when I import only a couple of exports like this: ``` import { Input, Label } from '../../node_modules/@zooplus/zoo-web-components/dist/esm/zoo-web-components.js'; ``` All exports are being put into the final bundle instead of imported two classes. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/GeorgeTailor/angular-webpack-esmodule-import ``` git clone https://github.com/GeorgeTailor/angular-webpack-esmodule-import.git cd angular-webpack-esmodule-import npm i npm start ``` in the code inside the project I use the following to import only two components: ``` import { Input, Label } from '../../node_modules/@zooplus/zoo-web-components/dist/esm/zoo-web-components.js'; new Input(); // constructor call so that it's not removed by webpack new Label(); // constructor call so that it's not removed by webpack ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error The whole bundle is imported, along with buttons, selects and other components. I would expect webpack to import only `Input` and `Label` along with any chained dependencies, but not the whole bundle. ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


Angular CLI: 11.2.8
Node: 14.15.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.8
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.8
@angular/cli                    11.2.8
@schematics/angular             11.2.8
@schematics/update              0.1102.8
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.1.5

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support specifying stylesheet language for inline component styles
Issues.Body: A new build option named `inlineStyleLanguage` has been introduced that will allow a project to define the stylesheet language used in an application's inline component styles. Inline component styles are styles defined via the `styles` property within the Angular `Component` decorator. Both JIT and AOT mode are supported. However, JIT mode requires that inline styles only be string literals (compile-time partial evaluation is not supported in JIT mode). Currently supported language options are: `css` (default), `sass`, `scss`, and `less`. If the option is not specified, `css` will be used and enables existing projects to continue to function as expected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support specifying stylesheet language for inline component styles" (#20514)

Issues.Title: fix(material/snack-bar): clear timeout upon dismiss with action
Issues.Body:
This is very similar to #4860 where a programmatic dismiss
cancelled the timeout. This patch is for a manual dismiss via
clicking on the snackbar action.

It is especially useful in e2e tests with Protractor, because
Protractor always wait for Angular to become stable. With this patch
Protractor does not need to wait if the action is clicked, saving
potentially a lot of time in repetitive e2e tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/snack-bar): clear timeout upon dismiss with action" (#22485)

Issues.Title: Improve mat-form-field layout according to specs
Issues.Body:
I'm talking specifically about `<mat-form-field appearance="outline">` with text input inside but I guess it may be relevant for other types of form components as well.

Here's what we have in [specs](https://material.io/components/text-fields):
1. Nicely vertically aligned input...
2. which covers whole .mdc-text-field block...
3. which has correct height of 56px...
4. which has correctly positioned prefix icon...
5. which doesn't affect position of label when the field has focus or value...
6. etc...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25200186/114692130-021f0100-9d21-11eb-893d-df0b5ca48610.png)


Here's what we currently have in Angular Material:
1. Weird structure.
2. Incorrect height of 58.76px.
3. Prefix icon without any margin/padding...
4. which affects position of the label in "active" state...
5. etc...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25200186/114694012-d43abc00-9d22-11eb-93a3-2fbd9a50e8ba.png)


I think it's important for such essential form component to meet specs. Until then it brings troubles of hack-fixing layout things just to make it look fine or be similar to Material components from other libraries that follow specs.

It's probably duplication of [similar issue](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/11513) which is going to celebrate 3 years with status "open" next month 😞
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Improve mat-form-field layout according to specs" (#22477)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/testing): incorrectly handling ancestor of compound selector
Issues.Body:
Currently the component harness handles the `ancestor` option by prepending it to the `hostSelector` of the harness. This breaks down if the `hostSelector` is a compound selector, because we end up with something like `.parent .a, .b`, rather than `.parent .a, .parent .b`.

These changes resolve the issue and add a bit of extra logic to account for the case where the selector might include commas inside quotes which will break us, because we split compound selectors on the comma. The logic is loosely based on my changes from https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38716.

Fixes #22475.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/testing): incorrectly handling ancestor of compound selector" (#22476)

Issues.Title: cdkTextareaAutosize throws when ng-content has *ngIf
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

[StackBlitz example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/cdktextareaautosize-bug-can-not-read-appendchild)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a textarea with the cdkTextareaAutosize directive.
2. Create a wrapper component with a *ngIf for the projected content ```<ng-content *ngIf="true"></ng-content>```. It also happens with *ngTemplateOutlet, so probably it happens with any structural directive.
3. Wrap the textarea with the wrapper component ```<app-wrapper><textarea cdkTextareaAutosize></textarea></app-wrapper>```.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
It should project the textarea input into the wrapper ng-content tag and show it when *ngIf evaluates to true.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
It throws: ```ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'appendChild' of null...```


#### Environment

- Angular: Last
- CDK/Material: Last
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "cdkTextareaAutosize throws when ng-content has *ngIf" (#22469)

Issues.Title: HarnessPredicate doesn't correctly apply ancestor selectors to compound component selectors
Issues.Body:
_Note(@jelbourn): Copied from an internal bug report_

HarnessPredicate.getSelector returns the wrong result in certain cases. E.g., MatButtonHarness and other CDK harnesses are defined as matching one of several possible selectors:

```
  static hostSelector = [
    '[mat-button]',
    '[mat-raised-button]',
    '[mat-flat-button]',
    '[mat-icon-button]',
    '[mat-stroked-button]',
    '[mat-fab]',
    '[mat-mini-fab]',
  ].join(',');
```

I would expect `getHarness(MatButtonHarness.with({ancestor: '.foo'}))` to always find a MatButton that has a '.foo' ancestor. However, the current implementation of https://source.corp.google.com/search?q=HarnessPredicate.getSelector returns:

```
.foo [mat-button],[mat-raised-button],[mat-flat-button],[mat-icon-button],[mat-stroked-button],[mat-fab],[mat-mini-fab]
```

which only applies the ancestor constraint to the first possibility.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HarnessPredicate doesn't correctly apply ancestor selectors to compound component selectors " (#22475)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk) Replacing datasource does not refresh/display items in cdk-virtual-scrollport
Issues.Body:
**Overview**

The first time you assign a datasource for iteration within the cdk-virtual-scrollport, all works as expected, as per the documentation example of displaying the first page of items. See "Virtual scroll with a custom data source" on https://material.angular.io/cdk/scrolling/examples

The bug however is if you subsequently try to assign a new instance of a datasource object to the same scroller. You will find that the scrollport will not request/display the first page of items from that new datasource **until the user scrolls the visible area**. 

**Motivation/Use Case**
In the real-world our virtual data can require some sort of user driven filtering, like a search screen. Which will require a complete replacement of all the underlying/cached data in the scroller with fresh results. This is ideally achieved by replacing the datasource when the user triggers the search.

**Expected Behavior**
Scroller should reset itself automatically when given a new datasource and request the first page of rows in exactly the same way it does when it was assigned the first datasource.

**Actual Behavior**
CollectionViewer does not fire an event to the subscription in connect() until it has a range that differs.

**Minimal repro:**
See https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-fs9xei-rgkahy?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-data-source-example.ts

Run the sample, initial list items will appear. Click on the "Switch datasource button", and you will see the items in the list stuck with saying "loading..." indefinitely. You have to scroll before the datasource actually gets asked for data to be able to be displayed.

**Environment**
Angular: 11
CDK/Material: 11
Browser(s): n/a
Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): n/a
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk) Replacing datasource does not refresh/display items in cdk-virtual-scrollport" (#22464)

Issues.Title: refactor: update `$schema` and `id` keyword
Issues.Body:
In Angular CLI version 12, JSON Schema `draft-04` will no longer be supported. Therefore `id` will need to be updated to `$id`.

- We replace id with $id, this no longer valid in draft-07.
- Replace all $schemas to http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema, this is needed to "pin" the schema to draft-07.

More information about this draft can be found https://json-schema.org/draft-07/json-schema-release-notes.html

Note: This change is backwards compatible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: update `$schema` and `id` keyword" (#22459)

`<map-marker *ngIf = "marker"

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/drag-drop): element not draggable when has initial transform …
Issues.Body:
existing cdkDrag will concat current transform value with what's calculated by cdkDrag. 
cdkDrag broken when initial transform value is none because `transform: none` is valid css but `transform: none translate3d(x, y, x)` is not.

i've added test cases to test cdkDrag that has initial `transform: none` value
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/drag-drop): element not draggable when has initial transform …" (#22458)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/drag-drop): drag broken when initial transform value is none
Issues.Body: This PR fixes the broken cdkDrag when the initial css transform value is none. This is because, it tries to preserve existing transform value and concatenate its own translate3d() value on top of existing one. `none translated(x, y)` is invalid css value.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/drag-drop): drag broken when initial transform value is none" (#22456)
